segment.source: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to create a standard set of AppLocker rules that will allow Windows system files to run.
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to create a standard set of AppLocker rules that will allow Windows system files to run.

segment.source: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to create a standard set of AppLocker rules that will allow Windows system files to run.
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to create a standard set of AppLocker rules that will allow Windows system files to run.

segment.source: AppLocker includes default rules for each rule collection.
segment.target: AppLocker includes default rules for each rule collection.

segment.source: These rules are intended to help ensure that the files that are required for Windows to operate properly are allowed to run.
segment.target: These rules are intended to help ensure that the files that are required for Windows to operate properly are allowed to run.

segment.source: Important: You can use the default rules as a template when creating your own rules to allow files within the Windows folders to run.
segment.target: Important: You can use the default rules as a template when creating your own rules to allow files within the Windows folders to run.

segment.source: However, these rules are only meant to function as a starter policy when you are first testing AppLocker rules.
segment.target: However, these rules are only meant to function as a starter policy when you are first testing AppLocker rules.

segment.source: The default rules can be modified in the same way as other AppLocker rule types.
segment.target: The default rules can be modified in the same way as other AppLocker rule types.

segment.source: You can perform this task by using the Group Policy Management Console for an AppLocker policy in a Group Policy Object (GPO) or by using the Local Security Policy snap-in for an AppLocker policy on a local computer or in a security template.
segment.target: You can perform this task by using the Group Policy Management Console for an AppLocker policy in a Group Policy Object (GPO) or by using the Local Security Policy snap-in for an AppLocker policy on a local computer or in a security template.

segment.source: For information how to use these MMC snap-ins to administer AppLocker, see Administer AppLocker.
segment.target: For information how to use these MMC snap-ins to administer AppLocker, see Administer AppLocker.

segment.source: Right-click the appropriate rule type for which you want to automatically generate default rules.
segment.target: Right-click the appropriate rule type for which you want to automatically generate default rules.

segment.source: You can automatically generate rules for executable, Windows Installer, script rules and Packaged app rules.
segment.target: You can automatically generate rules for executable, Windows Installer, script rules and Packaged app rules.
